page.title: 09NORTON SEWAGE WORKS (CONT)
page.content: The sewage treatment plant is being supplied by Whitehead and Pooler. After treatment it is proposed that the effluent will be discharged into the {R.WENT} with a suspended solids level of 15 parts per million. This will allow the R. Went below the plant to be upgraded to a Class 1B river whereas now below the sewage outlet it is classsed as a Class C river. Most sludge remaining at the works will eventually be discharged by tanker onto surrounding arable land. When completed therefore the new sewage works will allow for both industrial and residential development in the area served by the works and will be a significant environmental enhancement as far the R. Went is concerned.
